Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Pancreaticojejunostomy and Pancreaticogastrostomy in High-Risk Postoperative Pancreatic Fistula Patients

Participants.evidence: Adults undergoing elective pancreaticoduodenectomy with a high fistula risk score (7-10) were randomized

Objective.evidence: This study aims to determine the optimal reconstruction method

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was POPF incidence, measured postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment

Number_Randomised.evidence: 72 were randomized (36 to PJ, 36 to PG)

Number_Analysed.evidence: 72 were randomized (36 to PJ, 36 to PG)

Result_Outcome.evidence: POPF incidence was similar between groups (PJ: 38.9%, PG: 50.0%; P = .48)

Harms.evidence: PG had higher Clavien-Dindo grade 3 or higher morbidity (47.2% vs 22.2%; P = .047)
